summary: Email chain between a U.S. Attorney's Office representative and MDC staff regarding logistical issues in delivering encrypted discovery materials on a hard drive to Ghislaine Maxwell while she is incarcerated at the Metropolitan Detention Center. The correspondence details technical problems with file access and the protocol for sending password-protected drives.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The incarcerated defendant at MDC who is to receive discovery materials on a hard drive, but is reported to have issues opening certain files.

events.title: Delivery of first discovery hard drive to MDC
events.description: A hard drive containing discovery materials was delivered via FedEx to the Metropolitan Detention Center for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Second discovery hard drive sent
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sent another hard drive via FedEx containing all discovery in the case to date, including audio and video, to MDC for Maxwell.

events.title: Technical issues with discovery files reported
events.description: MDC staff reported that Maxwell was having difficulty opening certain files on the provided hard drive, prompting technical troubleshooting discussions.

locations: St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was incarcerated at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) as of August 2020.
The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was sending discovery materials to Maxwell via password-protected hard drives delivered by FedEx.
Protocol required hard drives to be mailed to the MDC legal department, etched with a number, and accompanied by an authorization memo and a separate cover letter with the password.
Maxwell reported technical issues opening certain files on the discovery hard drives, which were suspected to possibly be due to operator error.
The discovery materials included audio and video files.
